newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: CZECH C.BANK FOREX RESERVES RISE TO $12.7BLN - PAPER.
newsitem.headline: CZECH C.BANK FOREX RESERVES RISE TO $12.7BLN - PAPER.

text.p: Foreign exchange reserves of the Czech National Bank (CNB) edged up $30 million to $12.66 billion, according to a preliminary report published in the economic daily Hospodarske Noviny on Thursday.
A central bank official could not confirm the figures, but said official reserve figures would be released on Friday.

The central bank's reserves had dipped over the past quarter, but the paper quoted CNB spokesman Martin Svehla as saying the drop was the result of a change to the regime in which the central bank fixes the crown.
"The fall (over the past few months) in reserves was influenced by the departure of some short-term capital when we widened the fluctuation band for the crown," Svehla said.
In February 1996, the CNB widened the band within which it fixes the crown daily to +/- 7.5 percent of the midpoint of its dollar/mark basket. It used to fix crown at +/- 0.5 percent.
The move was taken to help introduce more currency risk in the crown, which has proved to be one of eastern Europe's most stable currencies.
